column5: Sent this to some of my fishing friends, but thought I'd post the link here, too.http://www.flixxy.com/the-bizarre-bo...ted-states.htmPooch
I know of course about Northwest Angle but much of the rest is new to me.
Great video on the border! Good cabin fever stuff!
Some more border trivia: When you are standing at Kettle Falls in Minnesota between Namakan and Rainy Lakes, Canada is to your south and the US is to the north.
Yup. In the picture below the U.S. is on the right (north) and the island on the right is Ontario (south) Same thing happens in Detroit.

I use to trap coyotes along the Saskatchewan and Montana border.When I was checking or setting traps close to the border the "Border Patrol" from the US would show up and ask me what I was doing.After about 5 times I finally asked them how they knew I was there.Evidently the Sask side had motion detectors and I was setting them off.The call would come into the Montana station and they'd come check me out.Bill
